image.altText: Victoria's treasurer Tim Pallas in parliament.

props.synopsis: Popular major projects – including the Airport Rail Link — have been put on the backburner as part of the Victorian government's pitch to be more fiscally responsible, in Treasurer's Tim Pallas's 10th budget.

title.children: Victorian ratepayers asked to help with budget repair as debt soars to record highs

image.altText: A map of Victoria with red, blue and green tabs saying winner, loser, neutral.

props.synopsis: Families with school-aged children are among the biggest winners in this year's budget. But as the government grapples with rising debt, there are some cuts and delays to major projects.

title.children: Who are the winners and losers in Victoria's 2024 state budget?

image.altText: Two tanks with Israeli flags on them.

props.synopsis: The Israeli Defense Forces say Israeli soldiers are now on the ground inside Rafah, Gaza's southern-most city. Follow live.

title.children: Israel says it has taken control of Palestinian side of Rafah crossing

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Civilians in Rafah 'cautious, scared and distrustful of IDF messaging'
Israel’s military has taken control of the Palestinian side of the Rafah crossing

image.altText: red brochure with school girl on the front

props.synopsis: The Victorian government's budget released today attempts modest cost savings, but the main message appears to be: don't panic.

title.children: In its 2024 budget, the Victorian government forgets debt, dreams big and crosses its fingers

image.altText: Two photos of two men with dark hair and beards, wearing high necked tops and standing in front of white backdrops.

props.synopsis: The brothers are due to face court in Goulburn, with investigators seeking their extradition back to Victoria.

title.children: Police track down brothers in NSW two days after fatal stabbing in Melbourne

props.synopsis: The son of an 81-year-old Benalla woman hit by an e-scooter near the MCG last week says he hopes the "gutless" rider feels ashamed about the incident, which police allege was deliberate.

title.children: 'Gutless' act: Family speaks out after elderly Collingwood football fan hit by e-scooter near MCG

image.altText: A sketch of Erin Patterson wearing a blue jumper and thin framed black glasses with her hair tied back.

props.synopsis: Accused killer Erin Patterson formally pleads not guilty to murder over the alleged mushroom poisonings of three of her relatives, and elects to have her case "fast-tracked" to a Victorian Supreme Court trial.

title.children: Erin Patterson, accused of murdering three with mushroom meal, enters not guilty plea

image.altText: An orange sunset in a cloudy sky over the rocky shoreline of Saibai

props.synopsis: Five men are in custody on Saibai Island in the Torres Strait after being caught crossing into Australia illegally.

title.children: Five men in custody after being caught crossing illegally into Australia

image.altText: Yarra Valley Grammar School sign

props.synopsis: Yarra Valley Grammar has expelled two students after the discovery of a document that used offensive terms to rank female pupils.

title.children: Two boys expelled from Melbourne private school over offensive spreadsheet ranking female students

image.altText: An older woman with a dark grey bob and glasses speaks into a small microphone in front of a blue screen.

props.synopsis: Reserve Bank keeps interest rates on hold at 4.35 per cent, but vows to remain vigilant and warns it "is not ruling anything in or out".

title.children: Reserve Bank keeps interest rates on hold at 4.35 per cent

image.altText: A young white woman with long blonde hair sitting on a couch

props.synopsis: Student groups have described a Commonwealth payment aimed at combating "placement poverty" as "a slap in the face" that's too little, too late, and voiced concerns a means test will restrict access.

title.children: Upcoming 'placement poverty' payment is a 'slap in the face', students groups say

image.altText: A man on a stage with flags behind him points towards the middle distance

props.synopsis: Next week's budget will see an increase in welfare payments, Treasurer Jim Chalmers reveals, while warning the government needs to be careful about what it can afford.

title.children: Treasurer flags welfare measures in next week's budget

image.altText: Bonza planes on tarmac

props.synopsis: More details emerge over the full extent of the budget airline's collapse with nearly 60,000 customers and 120 suppliers owed money.

title.children: Federal court hears Bonza creditors' meeting 'would need a stadium' with 60,000 affected customers

image.altText: Police officers lead a man into the back of a police car

props.synopsis: Two men, including a former childcare worker, will likely spend decades behind bars after being sentenced for hundreds of child abuse offences.

title.children: Two men jailed for total of 63 years for 'some of the most evil crimes imaginable'

image.altText: A woman of Indian descent stands looking solemn on a university campus.

props.synopsis: International student Varnika Singh was filmed by one of her assailants during the attack at the University of Wollongong. Those responsible have been sentenced, but an advocate says such incidents are on the rise.

title.children: 'Helpless in the moment': Uni student told to kiss attacker's shoe during knifepoint robbery

image.altText: Kyllie Cripps and a graphic of closed hands.

props.synopsis: The disproportionate number of First Nations women affected by violence is at the forefront of roundtable talks in Canberra, where the country's gendered violence experts, service directors and survivor-advocates have gathered.

title.children: Calls for 'real action' as First Nations women at centre of roundtable talks on gendered violence

image.altText: HMAS Hobart’s embarked MH-60R helicopter.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has not spoken to China's President Xi Jinping, as diplomatic tensions with Beijing re-emerge after a dangerous Chinese military interception of an Australian Navy helicopter in international waters.

title.children: Albanese hasn't spoken with President Xi Jinping after Chinese military confrontation

image.altText: A man holding a red umbrella and two women walk past a black wall that reads Reserve Bank of Australia.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank announces interest rates will remain on hold at 4.35 per cent, despite some economists saying a hike is needed to curb inflation. Follow live.

title.children: RBA warns path to curbing inflation 'unlikely to be smooth' as it leaves rates on hold again

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX ends higher after RBA leaves rates at 12-year high
November rate hike was 'a bit of insurance', Bullock says
Even the RBA governor is shocked by the price of petrol

image.altText: Composite image of Tyla, Doja Cat, Lizzo and Chris Hemsworth attending the 2024 Met Gala.

props.synopsis: You’ve seen all the Met Gala looks, now it’s time for the experts’ review on the couture of it all.

title.children: Four Australian fashion icons help us unpack the Met Gala

image.altText: A close up of Zendaya wearing a black corset with a headpiece that looks like a bouquet of roses

props.synopsis: The dress code was inspired by a short story about a count and countess who use their enchanted garden to buy themselves time against an encroaching angry mob.

title.children: Met Gala red carpet: How the stars interpreted the Garden of Time theme

image.altText: Nala Mansell holding bag at office desk.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Aboriginal Centre says it is "horrified" after the coroner's office dropped off human remains in brown paper bags without warning to its reception on Friday.

title.children: Human remains, potentially over a thousand years old, dropped off to Aboriginal group in paper bags

image.altText: A photo of a child in school uniform attached to a fridge.

props.synopsis: A transgender prisoner policy was issued in 2009. It was meant to ensure the safety of transgender and other prisoners. But, over the next eight years, Marjorie Harwood was repeatedly placed with males and experienced significant trauma.

title.children: Marjorie's family thought her placement in male prison was a mistake. A phone call confirmed it was more than that

image.altText: A boy plays on an iPad

props.synopsis: In this week's round-up of tech news, a closer inspection reveals the tricky aspects of implementing age verification for porn, OpenAI is due to launch its own search tool and Reddit sleuths seek out the origins of the most mysterious song on the internet.

title.children: The difficulty of age verification for porn, Open AI's search threat, and the most mysterious song on the internet

image.altText: A crowd of people walking in a city with high rise buildings in the background on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: After near-unanimous calls for multiple interest rate cuts a few months ago, economists now think more hikes are on the cards. But even though inflation is proving difficult to contain, increasing rates further still may not be the answer.

title.children: Evidence tells us that we're only spending on necessities, so why are the experts advocating for more rate hikes?

image.altText: A park sign

props.synopsis: Police have declared a crime scene at bushland in the Toowoomba suburb of Middle Ridge after what they believe to be human bones were discovered by a member of the public yesterday afternoon.

title.children: Human bones believed found in Glen Lomond Park bushland on Toowoomba escarpment

image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone

props.synopsis: Netflix's adaptation of Chinese sci-fi novel The Three-Body Problem is just one chapter of the series' challenging journey to the West. The books appear to tell a China story that Beijing is hesitant to share with the world — especially when it also involves a murder.

title.children: A young entrepreneur pushed for Netflix's 3 Body Problem adaptation. He was murdered before he could see it

image.altText: Smoke rises across a skyline and houses after a military strike

props.synopsis: Hamas says it has accepted a ceasefire proposal from Egypt and Qatar, but Israel says the deal the group has agreed to is "far from" its "necessary requirements".

title.children: Hamas accepts ceasefire proposal in Gaza war, Israel pushes on with attack on Rafah

image.altText: Donald Trump sits in court in a suit and red tie looking at the camera

props.synopsis: The judge overseeing Donald Trump's criminal trial said he would hold the former president in contempt of court for a tenth time for violating a gag order and said he would consider jailing him for further violations.

title.children: 'Truly the last resort': Judge warns of jail time for Donald Trump after tenth gag order breach

image.altText: A young man in a blue shirt standing in a field. There is a horse in the background.

props.synopsis: After finding anecdotal success with low doses of naltrexone, Griffith University researchers will undertake clinical trials involving the drug and a placebo to see its effect on long COVID sufferers.

title.children: Jayden took a drug designed for substance dependence after developing long COVID

image.altText: Two girls stand with their backs to the camera holding two puppies.

props.synopsis: The ACT Civil and Administrative Tribunal rules the education directorate should review its procedures after a 15-year-old fell into diabetic ketoacidosis during class at a Canberra school in 2023.

title.children: 'They didn't call me': 15yo girl develops diabetic ketoacidosis at ACT school, prompting tribunal ruling

image.altText: A schoolboy wearing a black backpack with his face digitally blurred.

props.synopsis: Police have seized items from the family home of a 16-year-old schoolboy who was fatally shot by officers as they probe the motivation behind his weekend knife attack.

title.children: 'No cell or conspiracy': Police seize Perth teen's mobile phones as stabbing attack motivation probed

image.altText: A woman with short curly hair and a purple scare sits in a chair looking serious.

props.synopsis: Caseworkers, foster carers, and even those in the judiciary have revealed the extent to which the NSW government is failing to protect children after the release of a "harrowing" report last week.

title.children: Caseworkers burnt out and quitting in 'broken' NSW child protection system as vulnerable kids go unseen
